summary: A video featuring Jonathan Kingston, discussing his career, family, and notable photographic works. Set in National Geographic Fine Art Galleries.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black suit playing the violin in front of a National Geographic Art Gallery backdrop, featuring a lion's portrait. The scene transitions to Jonathan Kingston, a freelance photographer for National Geographic, speaking in front of an underwater elephant image. The video then shifts to an art gallery where three people, including a man in a white shirt, engage in conversation amidst various artworks. The video returns to Jonathan Kingston, who continues to speak in front of the underwater elephant image, maintaining a consistent visual theme.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with soothing music, evoking a sentimental mood with its string instruments. A male speaker then introduces himself as Jonathan Kingston, a photographer for the National Geographic Image Collection, describing his work for the magazine and its expeditions arm. He explains the image collection as an in-house agency representing photographers who've worked for the magazine, finding assignments and managing their stock archive. He mentions his father is a very famous guy.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt and dark pants sitting at a table in a gallery, surrounded by various framed artworks, including a bustling train station scene and a lion's portrait. He appears to be speaking, with a water bottle on the table beside him. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man, now in front of a screen displaying an underwater image of a swimming elephant, suggesting a thematic connection to nature or wildlife. The video then shifts to a gallery setting where the man is engaged in conversation with another individual, who is holding a card and wearing a black jacket with red accents. The gallery walls are adorned with framed photographs, and a banner reading "National Geographic Fine Art Series" is visible, indicating the event's affiliation with the renowned organization. The video returns to the man in front of the underwater elephant image, continuing his dialogue, possibly elaborating on the artwork or the event's theme. The consistent presence of the underwater elephant image and the gallery setting throughout the video emphasizes the focus on nature and art, creating a cohesive narrative that ties the man's speech to the visual elements of the gallery and the featured artworks.
events_list.audio_caption: A single male speaker enthusiastically recounts that his father, an organic chemist who emigrated from London and was educated at Cambridge and MIT, helped invent a drug called Taxol, used for breast and ovarian cancer. The speaker then mentions his mother, an analytical chemist, helped invent the magenta dye used in Polaroids, followed by humorously saying, "so you know, obviously there are no expectations in my family of being a scientist".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a group of people sitting in a dimly lit room, engaged in a conversation. The room features a large screen displaying a vivid image of a tiger's face, while another screen shows a scenic view of a field with a sunset. The individuals are dressed casually, with one person wearing a patterned dress and boots, and another in a white tank top. The atmosphere is relaxed and conversational. The scene transitions to a close-up of a man in a white shirt, speaking in front of a screen showing an underwater image of a large animal, possibly a whale, swimming. The lighting is focused on the man, highlighting his expressions and gestures as he speaks. The video then shifts to an art gallery setting, where people are observing and discussing various animal-themed artworks, including a painting of a lion and another of a leopard. The gallery is well-lit, with white walls and modern decor, creating an inviting atmosphere for art appreciation. The video returns to the man in the white shirt, continuing his discussion in front of the underwater animal image. The final scene shows a man in a suit conversing with two other individuals in a room adorned with framed animal photographs, including a close-up of a cow's face. The lighting is warm, and the atmosphere is professional and engaging. The video captures a blend of casual conversation, artistic appreciation, and professional dialogue, all centered around the theme of animal imagery.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker reflecting on his less-than-stellar academic performance, especially in high school. He then shifts to the topic of how he discovered photography, mentioning a vocational program with a "great photo teacher". He shares that he learned about "focal lengths and lenses" and other photography-related concepts, and participated in contests, where he was frequently successful. The audio ends with a single word, "Sweet".

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a white shirt speaking in front of a screen displaying an underwater scene with a large, dark silhouette of an elephant swimming. The man appears to be explaining or discussing the image behind him, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks directly at the camera. The scene transitions to a social setting where the same man, now dressed in a black suit, is engaged in conversation with two other individuals in a gallery-like environment. The background shows framed pictures on the walls, and the lighting is dim, creating a relaxed atmosphere. The video then returns to the initial setting, with the man in the white shirt continuing his discussion in front of the underwater elephant image. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with a focus on the man's presentation and the intriguing underwater scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker sharing an anecdote. He describes returning home from high school and announcing to his father his desire to become a professional photographer. He then describes his father, complete with a bowtie and British accent, advising him against it. The speaker recounts a back and forth that eventually leads to his father's conditional blessing, advising him to get a degree in anything but photography to have other skills to fall back on. The male speaker's voice is conversational, storytelling.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt speaking in front of a screen displaying an underwater scene with a large elephant swimming. The scene transitions to a gallery setting where a man in a black blazer and white shirt is engaging with a group of people. The gallery is adorned with various artworks, including a painting of a horse and a landscape. The man in the blazer appears to be explaining or discussing something, gesturing with his hands, while the audience listens attentively. The atmosphere is casual and social, with some attendees holding drinks and others using their phones. The lighting is warm, highlighting the artworks and creating a welcoming environment. The video captures the interaction between the speaker and the audience, emphasizing the educational and social aspects of the gallery event.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker stating, "And I get it, I'm a new dad," then mentions having a "10-month-old daughter at home." He then discusses the Fine Arc Galleries and their start in "2016 if I remember correctly." His tone is conversational and casual. There are no music or background sounds present.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black suit and white shirt standing in an art gallery, gesturing with his hand near his chest. The gallery is filled with people, some holding wine glasses, and various artworks are displayed on the walls, including a painting of a lion and a landscape. The scene transitions to a close-up of the same man, now wearing a white shirt, speaking in front of a screen showing an underwater image of a large animal, possibly a whale, swimming. The lighting is dim, focusing on the man and the screen behind him. The video then shifts to a stunning image of a large wave in the ocean, captured at sunset, with the wave's crest curling dramatically and sunlight reflecting off the water, creating a golden glow. The scene returns to the man in the white shirt, continuing to speak in front of the underwater image, maintaining the same dim lighting and focus on the screen behind him. The video concludes with the man still speaking, emphasizing his points with hand gestures, while the underwater image remains a constant backdrop.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker with a conversational and passionate tone. He describes how the National Geographic image collection contacted him to be part of their galleries, and he recounts the experience of taking the "Heartwave shot". He details the conditions at a specific spot on the island of Molokai, a west-facing white sand beach with a 90-degree turn, where sand washes away during storms, creating a slope.  Here, the waves collide to form explosions of water under the luminous sunset light.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt speaking in front of a screen displaying an underwater scene of an elephant swimming. The scene transitions to a stunning view of a large wave crashing in the ocean, with sunlight reflecting off the water, creating a beautiful contrast of colors. The video then returns to the underwater scene, showing the elephant swimming gracefully, with its silhouette clearly visible against the blue water. The video concludes with the man continuing to speak in front of the screen, which now shows the elephant swimming underwater again. The overall atmosphere of the video is serene and captivating, highlighting the beauty of nature and the unique sight of an elephant swimming in the ocean.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker discussing photography, describing the predictability of the "light's great" conditions, and then noting how the heart wave was something unpredictable, feeling like a "miracle". He then transitions to discussing the "swimming elephant" shot, stating that it's one of his favorites. He mentions the work it took to capture it over two years and discusses its ethereal feel and the special place it holds in his heart.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt and dark blazer engaging in conversation with two women in a gallery setting, surrounded by framed artworks. The man, who has a microphone clipped to his shirt, appears to be explaining something, gesturing with his hands. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man, now in front of a large underwater photograph of an elephant, which serves as a backdrop. He continues to speak, with the camera focusing on his upper body and the photograph behind him. The video then shows the man standing next to the framed photograph, providing context to the artwork. The gallery environment is dimly lit, with other artworks visible in the background, creating an intimate atmosphere. The video concludes with the man still in front of the underwater elephant photograph, maintaining a consistent focus on his upper body and the artwork behind him.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker describing his experience as a new graduate of Brooks Institute of Photography in 2002, recalling his first job teaching at a photo school in South India. He explains that one night, he watched an old Jacques Cousteau special on Discovery Channel titled "Andaman Islands Invisible Islands." The male speaker then summarizes the special, stating that Jacques Cousteau talked about elephants brought to the Andaman Islands that would swim between islands, with some islands having female elephants and others having male elephants. When the elephants went into musth, they would swim from one island to another to mate before returning to the island where their caretakers were.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt speaking in front of a screen displaying an underwater scene of an elephant swimming. The scene transitions to a close-up of the elephant underwater, with sunlight filtering through the water, creating a serene atmosphere. The video then shifts to an art gallery where a man in a suit is conversing with two women, one holding a wine glass. The gallery is adorned with various artworks, including a landscape painting and a blue abstract piece. The video returns to the man in the white shirt, continuing his discussion in front of the underwater elephant image. The video concludes with a close-up of the man, emphasizing his expressions and gestures as he speaks.
events_list.audio_caption: A man speaks in an excited tone, describing seeing a special and instantly picturing a shot of a "swimming elephant." He then describes the Andaman Islands as an Indian naval base and how difficult it is for an American to get there. He explains that, because the elephants are considered government employees, he needed permission from the Ministry of Environment and Forest to film them. He describes taking a train from Udhagamandalam down to Chennai and an airplane to the Andaman Islands. He says that he got upgraded to first class and was thinking about the shot in his head when a flight attendant gave him the Port Blair Times newspaper.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a white shirt with a microphone clipped to it is seen speaking in front of a screen displaying an underwater scene featuring a large, dark silhouette of an elephant swimming. The man appears to be engaged in a discussion or presentation, as indicated by his facial expressions and gestures. The background is dimly lit, with the focus on the screen and the man, creating a professional and informative atmosphere. The underwater image of the elephant adds a unique and intriguing visual element to the scene, suggesting that the topic of discussion may be related to marine life or conservation efforts. The man's expressions and movements convey a sense of enthusiasm and expertise as he addresses the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker begins by describing opening something and reading a headline: "Chief Minister of environment and forests indicted for corruption and jailed." He continues in a dismayed tone, saying he "felt like someone had just punched me in the stomach," realizing "permission was off" and "the shoot was off."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a white shirt with a microphone clipped to it is seen speaking directly to the camera. The background features a large screen displaying an underwater scene with a silhouette of an elephant swimming. The man appears to be engaged in a discussion or presentation, as he uses hand gestures to emphasize his points. The lighting in the room is dim, focusing attention on the speaker and the screen behind him. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with the underwater elephant image adding a unique visual element to the setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker, who expresses that he's at the end of his first year in India and only signed a one-year contract. He re-ups his contract and he's not going to name the island, because he doesn't want "a ton of people going out to this island", but there are two elephants living on it. One side of the island was very shallow, while the other had bathymetry that "fell off very steeply from very shallow to very deep".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt speaking in front of a screen displaying an underwater scene with a large marine animal, possibly a whale, swimming. The scene transitions to a social gathering where a man in a dark blazer and light blue shirt is holding a bottle and a glass, engaging with others in a well-lit room with wooden paneling and a bar area. The atmosphere is casual, with people mingling and holding drinks. The video then returns to the initial setting, with the man in the white shirt continuing his speech in front of the underwater scene, maintaining a consistent background and lighting. The video concludes with the man still speaking, emphasizing the continuity of his presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker recounting a story about his experiences filming elephants. He describes starting his day on one side of the island and shooting black and white film of an elephant swimming, mentioning they "don't swim for long," then moving to the other side with color film.  He talks about waiting in a boat and being signaled to start filming the "daily bathing ritual" as the elephant swims out. The speaker is calm and narrative.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a white shirt with a microphone clipped to it is seen speaking directly to the camera. Behind him, a large screen displays an underwater scene featuring a silhouette of an elephant swimming gracefully in the deep blue ocean. The lighting in the room is dim, focusing attention on the man and the screen. The man appears to be engaged in a discussion or presentation, as indicated by his facial expressions and the slight movements of his mouth and head. The background image of the swimming elephant adds a serene and intriguing visual element to the scene, creating a contrast between the man's formal attire and the natural, mysterious underwater world depicted on the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing a photographic experience, detailing how he took 36 photos, but only one turned out well. He recounts that in the other shots, the elephant appeared with "one leg" or missing various body parts.  He notes the successful shot captured everything perfectly, adding that the elephant "only swam for five or ten minutes" before leaving. Then he shares a detail about the photograph's background by telling the "story of that shot."  Subsequently, the speaker states he heard many stories from India about "mahouts."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a white shirt and dark blazer standing in front of a large framed photograph of an elephant swimming underwater, set against a dark wall with other framed pictures. He smiles and gestures towards the photograph, engaging with the audience. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man speaking directly to the camera, with the underwater elephant image still visible in the background. The video then shifts to a wider shot of the man standing in a room with a group of people, some holding drinks, as he continues to speak and gesture. The room features a high table with a white cloth, and the background includes more framed pictures and a wooden wall. The man continues to speak in front of the underwater elephant image, maintaining a consistent setting. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the text 'Globalize Productions Matthew Dimakos matthewdimakos@gmail.com 917-601-6407' in white, providing contact information for the production company and individual.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker recounting a story about mahouts and elephants, noting that it's a recurring event in elephant camps, where drunken mahouts are gently carried back to their huts by their elephants. He then transitions to discussing his photography, stating that, while capturing a story through photography, nothing else exists around him, only that moment, that story, that joy. He describes the feeling of pressing the shutter, experiencing a tingle up his arm and into his brain, feeling on fire. The speaker further quotes a friend saying, "celebrate what's right with the world," emphasizing the importance of focusing on the good amidst negativity, and choosing to celebrate the positive aspects of the world as much as possible.  A light, ambient musical piece plays during the speech, complementing the reflective and hopeful tone of the speaker.
